content.title: Energy Governance for a Just Energy Transition
content.cta: Scroll, tab or use your keyboard to move ahead

content.text: This module explores energy governance as a key enabler of a just energy transition, introducing the Energy Governance focus areas—inclusive and effective institutions, civic engagement, legal and regulatory frameworks, and independent oversight—alongside four cross-cutting approaches: people-centered inclusivity, multi-level governance, digital enablement, and adaptability. It provides insights into policy coherence, stakeholder engagement, and transparency, with case studies illustrating governance challenges and solutions. The module equips decision-makers with tools to strengthen accountability, inclusivity, and institutional effectiveness, ensuring energy transitions are equitable, sustainable, and responsive to evolving global needs.

content.title: Learning Objectives
content.intro: If you only have space to remember 3 things:

objectives.title: Understand what energy governance is and how it can act as an enabler in achieving energy access and accelerating a just energy transition.
Identify and describe the four focus areas o Energy Governance along with some examples and recommendations
Learn about four critical cross-cutting approaches crucial for these focus areas
Learn about the stakeholder engagement, political economy understanding, policy coherence, adaptive regulations, de-risking and other critical aspects of governance.
